results.title: The British Commonwealth of Nations
results.brief_description: A survey of the historical and economic factors on which the Commonwealth was built; the trading companies, the missionary movement, empire builders, the freeing of colonial governments, provide a background for an understanding of the Commonwealth. Analyses the political, social and economic interests and ties which have held the nations together and its importance on world history.

results.title: Britannia: a bridge
results.creator_credit: David Lochner, John Shearman, British Transport Films and Visionaire Productions
results.brief_description: Menai Strait was completely gutted by fire in 1970. The reconstruction work included steel arches over the seaway and the use of the masonry piers which were a major feature of the original bridge

results.title: Britain's sporting heritage
results.brief_description: A montage of favourite sporting events in Britain. Athletics, tennis, skating, golf and cycling; team games including soccer and rugby, cricket and hockey. Famous sporting personalities and some young champions of the future in action.

results.title: Britain on show
results.creator_credit: John Durst, Anthony Gilkison and Rayant Pictures
results.brief_description: Britain’s contribution to the Brussels Universal and International Exhibition of 1958. A picture of the British people and their achievements in modern agriculture, industry, science, technology, and public administration, through examples from the exhibition. Aspects of life and work today, including young people at university, engineers building an atomic power station, teenagers dancing in a London cellar, and the Comet jet airliner under construction. Commentary by Stanley Van Beers.

results.title: Britain now
results.creator_credit: John Spencer, Stuart Legg and Anglo-Scottish Pictures
results.brief_description: In 1945, Britain emerged from the war to find that, although victorious, there lay ahead a tremendous task of reconstruction; cities to be rebuilt, trade to be revived and exports to be stepped up. The film tells the story of Britain’s post-war recovery, thanks to the courage and determination of her people. Overseas, three great nations have achieved independence within the Commonwealth, and in the Dependencies, new constitutions are paving the way to self-government. Narrated by Leo Genn.

results.title: The Bright young newcomer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problem Series”.
One of a series of six films designed to help supervision and middle management improve human relations in the office. By failing to properly channel the initiative of the bright young newcomer, the supervisor is presented with an unpleasant ultimatum by his senior clerk. For the audience to discuss is the question as to what the supervisor could have done to avoid friction among the staff.
